abstract: Some of the largest banks and credit card companies in Britain will have to pay a total of up to $2 billion to customers who were sold inappropriate financial products, a British regulator said on Thursday.
snippet: Some of the largest banks and credit card companies in Britain will have to pay a total of up to $2 billion to customers who were sold inappropriate financial products, a British regulator said on Thursday.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — Some of the largest banks and credit card companies in Britain will have to pay a total of up to £1.3 billion, or $2 billion, to customers who were sold inappropriate financial products, a British regulator said on Thursday.

headline.main: British Credit Card Customers to Be Reimbursed
